title: Gallery Talk: Patience—The Rewards of Looking Longer
hero_caption: Donald Judd. Untitled, 1968. Through prior gifts of Mrs. Morton G. Schamberg and Mr. and Mrs. Edward E. Hokin; Charles H. and Mary F. Worcester Collection Fund; through prior gifts and bequest of Solomon B. Smith, Dr. and Mrs. Irving Forman...
short_description: The longer you look the more—and more differently—you see. Join educator Sam Ramos for a series of encounters that explore the concept of duration by reflecting on artworks that reward those who take their time.
description:
The longer you look the more—and more differently—you see. Join educator Sam Ramos for a series of encounters that explore the concept of duration by reflecting on artworks that reward those who take their time. 

Please note that the artwork on this page may not be featured during the gallery talk.

Persons with disabilities who would like to request an accessibility accommodation for an Art Institute program are encouraged to send an email to access@artic.edu two weeks in advance of the program.
